channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The East Village Trattoria Where the Italian Players Go Between Matches
item.description: A Manhattan trattoria has become the de facto lounge for Italians at the U.S. Open.

item.title: U.N. Pauses Aid Operations in Gaza After Israel Orders Evacuations
item.description: A senior United Nations official said the organization was working with the Israeli military to resume humanitarian work as soon as possible.

item.title: Why Telegram billionaire Pavel Durov’s arrest risks fanning diplomatic tensions between France, Russia and the UAE
item.description: Durov's messaging platform is used by nearly a billion users, and has played an especially key role in the Russia-Ukraine war.

item.title: Russia Pounds Wide Swath of Ukraine, and F.T.C. Fights Grocery Merger
item.description: Plus, the rock band Oasis is back.

item.title: Peloton’s former billionaire CEO says he’s lost all his money and had to sell his possessions
item.description: "I've lost all my money," says Peloton's ex-CEO John Foley

item.title: 21 Questions for Harris
item.description: We’re asking unanswered questions for her potential administration.

item.title: Max Verstappen’s undefeated home record is broken: Is this the beginning of the end for the Dutchman’s Formula One supremacy?
item.description: Lando Norris, the British driver two years Verstappen's junior, is seen as the most likely pretender to the Dutch crown.

item.title: Jury deliberating fate of Nevada politician accused of killing reporter who uncovered his affair
item.description: Closing arguments were heard Monday. Telles is accused of stabbing German after he learned that the reporter was about to expose an affair.
